blocks.content:
Hello

I'm currently a PhD candidate at the University of Alberta. My research focuses on using digital twin-based Extended Reality (VR, AR, and MR) to enhance fire safety management on construction sites, reducing construction workers' injuries and deaths, and property loss.

blocks.title: Developing a Digital Twin-based Framework for Construction Fire Hazard Recognition Training
blocks.authors: Kexin Liu, Mohamed Sabek, Gaang Lee, Max Kinateder, Vicente A. Gonzalez
blocks.venue: Proceedings of the International Symposium on Automation and Robotics in Construction (IAARC)

blocks.title: A scoping review of fire safety on building construction sites: current measures, practices and future research directions
blocks.authors: Kexin Liu, Vicente A. Gonzalez, Gaang Lee, Max Kinateder

blocks.title: Exploring Fire Safety Challenges on Construction Sites: Insights from Stakeholders
blocks.authors: Kexin Liu, Gaang Lee, Max Kinateder, Vicente A. Gonzalez

blocks.title: A Fuzzy Expert System for Measuring the Degree of Lean Implementation in Construction Projects
blocks.authors: Rana Ead, Kexin Liu, Amira Saleh, Sena Assaf, Vicente Gonzalez-Moret, Farook Hamzeh
blocks.venue: Annual Conference of the International Group for Lean Construction

blocks.title: The Analysis of Construction Workplace Incident Fatalities Using Text Mining and Classification Techniques
blocks.authors: Sena Assaf, Kexin Liu, Zeyu Mao, Amira Saleh, Abbey Abellanosa, Yasser Mohamed

blocks.title: Optimization Algorithm Based on Subset Simulation for Resource Leveling Problem with  Multiple Resources (2019-2021)
blocks.description:
Model Reformation: Introduced interval rate variables to the Resource Leveling Problem, eliminating the need for complex repair operators.
Performance Benchmarking: Validated the proposed algorithm in MATLAB, achieving higher stability and solution optimality than traditional Genetic Algorithms.
Application Development: Developed a MATLAB GUI to streamline the optimization process for end-users.

blocks.title: Evacuation Simulation for a High-Speed Railway Station During Construction (2017)
blocks.description:
BIM-Evacuation Modeling: Integrated BIM data into Pathfinder for mixed-flow worker and passenger simulations.
Scenario Evaluation: Analyzed emergency bottlenecks and flow inefficiencies under stair blockage and guided scenarios.
Efficiency Optimization: Reduced evacuation time by 23.7s, supporting data-driven safety planning.

blocks.title: Bentley Institute Student Design - (2016)
blocks.description:
UAV Data Acquisition: Captured high-resolution aerial imagery for reconstruction.
3D Reconstruction: Used Bentley ContextCapture to perform aerial triangulation and generate high-fidelity mesh models.
VR Integration: Used Bentley LumenRT to develop virtual reality scenes based on the 3D reconstruction model.

blocks.title: CIV E 265 - Engineering Drawing and Computer Graphics
CIV E 601 - Analytical Methods for Project Management
blocks.description: Teaching Assistant - Fall 2024

blocks.title: CIV E 409 - Construction Methods
blocks.description: Teaching Assistant - Winter 2024
